bullet | Failure The target is slowed 1 for 1 minute.
bullet | Critical Failure The target is slowed 2 for 1 minute.
description | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (6th) | <span style='font-size:8px'>  You can target up to 10 creatures.

title: Solid Fog
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You conjure a bank of fog so thick it impedes movement as well as sight. This functions as obscuring mist, except that the area is also difficult terrain. You can dismiss the spell.

title: Speak with Animals
contents: property | Casting | [AA] S, V; Duration 10 minutes

text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals. The spell doesn’t make them more friendly than normal. Cunning animals are likely to be terse and evasive, while less intelligent ones often make inane comments.

title: Speak with Plants
contents: property | Casting | [AA] S, V; Duration 10 minutes

text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You can ask questions of and receive answers from plants, but the spell doesn’t make them more friendly or intelligent than normal. Most normal plants have a distinctive view of the world around them, so they don’t recognize details about creatures or know anything about the world beyond their immediate vicinity.
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Cunning plant monsters are likely to be terse and evasive, while less intelligent ones often make inane comments.

title: Spider Climb
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Tiny clinging hairs sprout across the creature’s hands and feet, offering purchase on nearly any surface. The target gains a climb Speed equal to its Speed.
description | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (5th) | <span style='font-size:8px'>  The duration increases to 1 hour.

title: Spider Sting
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You magically duplicate a spider’s venomous sting. You deal 1d4 piercing damage to the touched creature and afflict it with spider venom. The target must attempt a Fortitude save.
bullet | Critical Success The target is unaffected.
bullet | Success The target takes 1d4 poison damage.
bullet | Failure The target is afflicted with spider venom at stage 1.
bullet | Critical Failure The target is afflicted with spider venom at stage 2.
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Spider Venom (poison); Level 1; Maximum Duration 4 rounds.
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Stage 1 1d4 poison damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round); Stage 2 1d4 poison damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round).

title: Stabilize
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Positive energy shuts death’s door. The target loses the dying condition, though it remains unconscious at 0 Hit Points.

title: Status
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> As long as you and the target are on the same plane of existence and both alive, you remain aware of its present state. You know the target’s direction from you, distance from you, and any conditions affecting it.
description | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (4th) | <span style='font-size:8px'>  The spell’s range increases to 30 feet, and you can target up to 10 creatures.

title: Stinking Cloud
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You create a cloud of putrid mist in the area. The cloud functions as obscuring mist except it sickens creatures that end their turns within the cloud. (The concealed condition is not a poison effect.)
bullet | Critical Success The creature is unaffected.
bullet | Success The creature is sickened 1.
bullet | Failure The creature is sickened 1 and slowed 1 while in the cloud.
bullet | Critical Failure The creature is sickened 2 and slowed 1 until it leaves the cloud.

title: Stone Tell
contents: property | Casting | [AA] S, V; Duration 10 minutes

text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You can ask questions of and receive answers from natural or worked stone. While stone is not intelligent, you speak with the natural spirits of the stone, which have a personality colored by the type of stone, as well as by the type of structure the stone is part of, for worked stone. A stone’s perspective, perception, and knowledge give it a worldview different enough from a human’s that it doesn’t consider the same details important. Stones can mostly answer questions about creatures that touched them in the past and what is concealed beneath or behind them.

title: Stone To Flesh
contents: property | Targets | petrified creature or human-size stone object

text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Manipulating the fundamental particles of matter, you convert stone into flesh and blood. You restore a petrified creature to its normal state or transform a stone object into a mass of inert flesh (without stone’s Hardness) in roughly the same shape.

title: Stoneskin
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> The target’s skin hardens like stone. It gains resistance 5 to physical damage, except adamantine. Each time the target is hit by a bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing attack, stoneskin‘s duration decreases by 1 minute.
description | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (6th) | <span style='font-size:8px'>  The resistance increases to 10.
description | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (8th) | <span style='font-size:8px'>  The resistance increases to 15.
description | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (10th) | <span style='font-size:8px'>  The resistance increases to 20.

title: Storm of Vengeance
contents: property | Duration | sustained up to 1 minute
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> A massive storm cloud forms in the air in a 360-foot burst.

text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Beneath it, rain begins to fall, and gales impose a -4 circumstance penalty to physical ranged attacks and weapon ranged attacks, and the air in the area becomes greater difficult terrain for flying creatures. When you Cast this spell and the first time each round you Sustain the Spell, you can choose one of the following storm effects. You can’t choose the same effect twice in a row.
description | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (10th) | <span style='font-size:8px'>  The range increases to 2,200 feet, and the cloud is a 1,000-foot burst.

title: Summon Animal
contents: property | Duration | sustained up to 1 minute
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You conjure an animal to fight for you. You summon a common creature that has the animal trait and whose level is -1.
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightening the spell increases the maximum level of creature you can summon.

title: Summon Elemental
contents: property | Duration | sustained up to 1 minute

text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You conjure an elemental to fight for you. This works like summon animal, except you summon a common creature that has the elemental trait and whose level is 1 or lower.
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened As summon animal.

title: Summon Fey
contents: property | Duration | sustained up to 1 minute
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You conjure a fey to fight for you. This works like summon animal, except you summon a common creature that has the fey trait and whose level is -1.
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened As summon animal.

title: Summon Giant
contents: property | Duration | sustained up to 1 minute
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You conjure a giant to fight for you. This works like summon animal, except you summon a common creature that has the giant trait and whose level is 5 or lower.
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened As summon animal.

title: Summon Plant or Fungus
contents: property | Duration | sustained up to 1 minute

text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You conjure a plant or fungus to fight for you. This works like summon animal, except you summon a common creature that has the plant or fungus trait and whose level is -1.
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened As summon animal.

title: Sunburst
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> A powerful globe of searing sunlight explodes in the area, dealing 8d10 fire damage to creatures and objects in the area, plus 8d10 additional Positive damage to undead creatures. Each creature and object in the area must attempt a Reflex save.
bullet | Critical Success The creature or object is unaffected.
bullet | Success The creature or object takes half damage.
bullet | Failure The creature or object takes full damage.

bullet | Critical Failure The creature or object takes full damage. If it’s a creature, it becomes blinded permanently. If the globe overlaps with an area of magical darkness, sunburst attempts to counteract the darkness effect.
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (+1) The fire damage increases by 1d10, and the Positive damage against undead increases by 1d10.

title: Tanglefoot
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> A vine covered in sticky sap appears from thin air, flicking from your hand and lashing itself to the target. Attempt a spell attack against the target.

bullet | Critical Success The target gains the immobilized condition and takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. It can attempt to Escape against your spell DC to remove the penalty and the immobilized condition.
bullet | Success The target takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. It can attempt to Escape against your spell DC to remove the penalty.
bullet | Failure The target is unaffected.
description | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (2nd) | <span style='font-size:8px'>  The effects last for 2 rounds.
description | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (4th) | <span style='font-size:8px'>  The effects last for 1 minute.

title: Tangling Creepers
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Dense, twitching creepers sprout from every surface and fill any bodies of water in the area. Any creature moving on the land, or Climbing or Swimming within the creepers, takes a -10- foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds while in the area. Once per round, you can make a vine lash out from any square within the expanse of creepers by using a single action, which has the concentrate trait. This vine has a 15-foot reach and makes a melee unarmed attack using your spell attack modifier. If the attack succeeds, the vine pulls the target into the creepers and makes it immobilized for 1 round or until the creature Escapes (against your spell DC), whichever comes first.

title: Tree Shape
contents: property | Casting | [AA] S, V; Duration 8 hours

text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You transform into a Large tree. Perception checks don’t reveal your true nature, but a successful Nature or Survival check against your spell DC reveals that you appear to be a tree that is strangely new to the area. While in tree form, you can observe everything around you, but you can’t act other than to end the spell, and your turn, by using a single action, which has the concentrate trait. As a tree, your AC is 20, and only status bonuses, status penalties, circumstance bonuses, and circumstance penalties affect you. Any successes and critical successes you roll on Reflex saves are failures.

title: Tree Stride
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You step into a living tree with a trunk big enough for you to fit inside it and instantly teleport to any tree of the same species within 5 miles that also has a sufficiently large trunk.

text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Once you enter the first tree, you instantly know the rough locations of other sufficiently large trees of the same species within range and can exit from the original tree, if you prefer.
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You can’t carry Extradimensional spaces with you; if you attempt to do so, the spell fails.
description | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (6th) | <span style='font-size:8px'>  The tree you exit can be up to 50 miles away.
description | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (8th) | <span style='font-size:8px'>  The tree you exit can be up to 500 miles away.
description | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (9th) | <span style='font-size:8px'>  The tree you exit can be anywhere on the same planet.

title: True Seeing
contents: property | Casting | [AA] S, V; Duration 10 minutes

text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You see things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, you can see the creature’s true form, but you don’t end the polymorph spell).

title: Unfettered Pack
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You free those who travel alongside you from environmental hindrances. Targets don’t take circumstance penalties to Speed from vegetation, rubble, winds, or other properties of the environment, whether or not the environment is magical, and they ignore difficult terrain from such environmental properties.
description | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (9th) | <span style='font-size:8px'>  The targets also ignore greater difficult terrain from environmental properties.

title: Ventriloquism
contents: property | Casting | [AA] S, V; Duration 10 minutes

text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Whenever you speak or make any other sound vocally, you can make your vocalization seem to originate from somewhere else within 60 feet, and you can change that apparent location freely as you vocalize. Any creature that hears the sound can attempt to disbelieve your illusion.

description | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (2nd) | <span style='font-size:8px'>  The spell’s duration increases to 1 hour, and you can also change the tone, quality, and other aspects of your voice. Before a creature can attempt to disbelieve your illusion, it must actively attempt a Perception check or otherwise use actions to interact with the sound.

title: Vital Beacon
contents: property | Casting | 1 minute (S, V); Duration until your next daily preparations
property | Duration | until your next daily preparations

text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Vitality radiates outward from you, allowing others to supplicate and receive Healing. Once per round, either you or an ally can use an Interact action to supplicate and lay hands upon you to regain Hit Points. Each time the beacon heals someone, it decreases in strength. It restores 4d10 Hit Points to the first creature, 4d8 Hit Points to the second, 4d6 Hit Points to the third, and 4d4 Hit Points to the fourth, after which the spell ends. You can have only one vital beacon active at a time.
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (+1) The beacon restores one additional die of Hit Points each time it heals, using the same die size as the others for that step.

title: Volcanic Eruption
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> The ground opens up, spraying a column of lava high into the air in a vertical cylinder, dealing 14d6 fire damage to creatures in the area. The lava rapidly cools and encases creatures in the area. A creature encased in rock is clumsy 1 and takes a -10?foot status penalty to its Speeds. All normal terrain is difficult terrain to a flying creature, and such creatures immediately descend 20 feet the moment they’re encased, but they don’t take damage from this fall. A creature encased in rock can attempt to Escape against your spell DC to end the effect. Otherwise, the creature remains encased until it takes a total of 50 damage, freeing it from the rock.

text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Additionally, creatures in the area and those within 5 feet of the lava column automatically take 3d6 fire damage from the intense heat, regardless of the results of their saving throws.
bullet | Critical Success The creature is unaffected.
bullet | Success The creature takes half damage.
bullet | Failure The creature takes full damage and is encased.
bullet | Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is encased.
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (+1) The damage in the area increases by 2d6, and the damage from the intense heat increases by 1d6.

title: Wall of Fire
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You raise a blazing wall that burns creatures passing through it. You create either a 5-foot-thick wall of flame in a straight line up to 60 feet long and 10 feet high, or a 5-foot-thick, 10-foot-radius ring of flame with the same height. The wall stands vertically in either form; if you wish, the wall can be of a shorter length or height. Everything on each side of the wall is concealed from creatures on the opposite side. Any creature that crosses the wall or is occupying the wall’s area at the start of its turn takes 4d6 fire damage.
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (+1) The fire damage increases by 1d6.

title: Wall of Ice
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You sculpt a barrier of ice that blocks sight and, once shattered, freezes foes. You create either a 1-foot-thick wall of ice in a straight line up to 60 feet long and 10 feet high (the wall doesn’t have to be vertical, but it must be anchored on both sides to a solid surface) or a 1-foot-thick, 10-foot radius hemisphere of ice.

text | <span style='font-size:8px'> The ice that makes up the wall is opaque. If you wish, the wall can be of a smaller length, height, or radius. You must create the 382 wall in an unbroken open space so its edges don’t pass through any creatures or objects, or the spell is lost.

text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Each 10-foot-by-10-foot section of the wall has AC 10, Hardness 10, and 40 Hit Points, and it’s immune to critical hits, cold damage, and precision damage. A section also has weakness to fire 15; a section of the wall destroyed by fire melts, evaporating into water and steam. A section destroyed by means other than fire leaves behind a chilling mass of ice that is difficult terrain and deals 2d6 cold damage to any creature passing through it.
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (+2) The Hit Points of each section of the wall increase by 10, and the cold damage dealt to creatures crossing a destroyed section increases by 1d6.

title: Wall of Stone
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You shape a wall of solid stone. You create a 1-inch-thick wall of stone up to 120 feet long, and 20 feet high. You can shape the wall’s path, placing each 5 feet of the wall on the border between squares. The wall doesn’t need to stand vertically, so you can use it to form a bridge or set of stairs, for example. You must conjure the wall in an unbroken open space so its edges don’t pass through any creatures or objects, or the spell is lost.

text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Each 5-foot-by-5-foot section of the wall has AC 10, Hardness 14, and 50 Hit Points, and it’s immune to critical hits and precision damage. A destroyed section of the wall can be moved through, but the rubble created from it is difficult terrain.
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (+2) The Hit Points of each section of the wall increase by 15.

title: Wall of Thorns
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Over the course of a minute, you cause a thick wall of thorny brambles to grow from the ground. You create a 5-foot-thick wall of brambles and thorns in a straight line up to 60 feet long and 10 feet high. You must create the wall in an unbroken open space so its edges don’t pass through any creatures or objects, or the spell is lost. The wall stands vertically. If you wish, the wall can be of a shorter length or height. Everything on each side of the wall has cover from creatures on the opposite side, and the wall’s spaces are difficult terrain. For every move action a creature uses to enter at least one of the wall’s spaces, that creature takes 3d4 piercing damage.

text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Each 5-foot-by-5-foot section of the wall has AC 10, Hardness 10, and 20 Hit Points. It’s immune to critical hits and precision damage. A destroyed section can be moved through freely.
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (+1) The Hit Points of each section of the wall increase by 5, and the piercing damage increases by 1d4.

title: Wall of Wind
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You create a barrier of gusting winds that hinders anything moving through it. The wall of swirling winds is 5 feet thick, 60 feet long, and 30 feet high. The wall stands vertically, but you can shape its path. Though the wall of wind distorts the air, it does not hamper sight. The wall has the following effects.
bullet | Critical Success The creature can move through the wall normally this turn.
bullet | Success The flying creature can move through the wall this turn, but the wall is difficult terrain.
bullet | Failure The wall stops the movement of the flying creature, and any remaining movement from its current action is wasted.
bullet | Critical Failure As failure, and the creature is pushed 10 feet away from the wall.

title: Water Breathing
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> The targets can breathe underwater.
description | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (3rd) | <span style='font-size:8px'>  The duration increases to 8 hours.
description | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (4th) | <span style='font-size:8px'>  The duration increases to until your next daily preparations.

title: Water Walk
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> The target can walk on the surface of water and other liquids without falling through. It can go underwater if it wishes, but in that case it must Swim normally. This spell doesn’t grant the ability to breathe underwater.

description | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (4th) | <span style='font-size:8px'>  The spell’s range increases to 30 feet, the duration increases to 1 hour, and you can target up to 10 creatures.

title: Weapon Storm
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You swing a weapon you’re holding, and the weapon magically multiplies into duplicates that swipe at all creatures in either a cone or an emanation. This flurry deals four dice of damage to creatures in the area. This damage has the same type as the weapon and uses the same die size. Determine the die size as if you were attacking with the weapon; for instance, if you were wielding a two-hand weapon in both hands, you’d use its two-hand damage die.
bullet | Critical Success The creature is unaffected.
bullet | Success The target takes half damage.
bullet | Failure The target takes full damage.
bullet | Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is subject to the weapon’s critical specialization effect.
text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (+1) Add another damage die.

title: Web
contents: text | <span style='font-size:8px'> You create a sticky web in the area that impedes creatures’ movement each time they try to move through it. Squares filled with the web are difficult terrain. Each square can be cleared of the web by a single attack or effect that deals at least 5 slashing damage or 1 fire damage. A square has AC 5, and it automatically fails its saving throws.

text | <span style='font-size:8px'> Each time a creature in the web begins to use a move action or enters the web during a move action, it must attempt an Athletics check or Reflex save against your spell DC to avoid taking a circumstance penalty to its Speeds or becoming immobilized. A creature that gets out of the web ceases to take a circumstance penalty to its Speed from the web.

bullet | Critical Success The creature is unaffected, and it doesn’t need to attempt further Athletics checks or saving throws against the web this turn. If it used an Athletics check, it clears the web from every square it leaves after leaving the square.
bullet | Success The creature is unaffected during its action. If it used an Athletics check, it clears the web from every square it leaves after leaving the square.
bullet | Failure The creature takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until the start of its next turn.

bullet | Critical Failure The creature is immobilized until the start of its next turn, after which it takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. It can attempt to Escape to remove its immobilized condition.
description | <span style='font-size:8px'> Heightened (4th) | <span style='font-size:8px'>  The spell’s area increases to a 20-foot burst, and its range increases to 60 feet.

title: Wind Walk
contents: property | Targets | you and up to five creatures touched Duration 8 hours

text | <span style='font-size:8px'> When you cast this spell, each target transforms into a vaguely cloud-like form and is picked up by a wind moving in the direction of your choice. You can change the wind’s direction by using a single action, which has the concentrate trait. The wind carries the targets at a Speed of 20 miles per hour, but if any of the targets make an attack, Cast a Spell, come under attack, or otherwise enter encounter mode, the spell ends for all targets just after they roll initiative, and they drift gently to the ground.
